title: Collaborative Learning Group Formation and Project-Based Social Problem Solving

context.prior_knowledge: Basic social science theory and foundational understanding of collaborative learning
context.additional_context: Project execution utilizing TAPPS and Jigsaw collaborative learning patterns in a BYOD environment, with flexible group restructuring reflecting learner roles (students/job seekers).

learning_goals: Learners can understand the group formation principles based on Collaborative Learning Flow Patterns (CLFP) and autonomously form 3-4 member teams according to given constraints.
Learners can complete group reorganization complying with CLFP rules within 10 minutes in response to unexpected situations (e.g., absences/role changes) during project progress.
Learners can achieve over 80% social interaction among team members using collaborative learning tools while performing PBL tasks.

resources: IMS Learning Design-Compliant Collaboration Pattern Template

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
